function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"35 cohort studies and 69 cross-sectional studies, including 18 large scale ecological studies, may increase the risk of disease transmission due to the close contact and interactions among participants.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread in the population and potential outbreak of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement strict hygiene and sanitation measures during the conduct of the studies, including regular disinfection of study environments and proper ventilation.","Technologies":"Air purification systems, surface disinfection technologies, and remote data collection methods to reduce physical interaction.","People":"Participants in the studies, research staff, and individuals in the surrounding community.","Owner":"Research institutions, study organizers, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Assessments of quality were initially made by one reviewer and then cross-checked by another, potentially leading to discrepancies in identifying risks of disease transmission in the study environments.","Impact":"Unidentified risks of disease transmission due to discrepancies in quality assessments, leading to potential spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement standardized training and guidelines for quality assessments to ensure consistent identification and mitigation of disease transmission risks.","Technologies":"Quality assessment tools with built-in risk assessment modules, virtual collaboration platforms for joint assessments, and automated risk flagging systems for discrepancies.","People":"Reviewers conducting quality assessments, research staff, and individuals involved in data collection and analysis.","Owner":"Research institutions, quality assessment organizations, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Close interactions and discussions during the consensus process for quality assessments may pose a risk of disease transmission among the individuals involved.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of disease spread among the individuals conducting consensus discussions, potentially leading to the transmission of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Conduct consensus discussions in well-ventilated areas with limited physical proximity, use personal protective equipment, and encourage regular testing for contagious diseases among the individuals involved.","Technologies":"Virtual collaboration platforms for consensus discussions, video conferencing tools, and remote participation options for consensus meetings.","People":"Individuals involved in consensus discussions, research staff, and quality assessment teams.","Owner":"Research institutions, quality assurance organizations, and public health authorities."}]}
